intro: Byronia sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a rare shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, often near streams or in rocky habitats. It has distinctive yellowish-green stems and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
